intro: Brachyloma elusum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, woody fruits. Brachyloma elusum is often found in heathlands and is a characteristic species of the Australian flora.
